term.title: narcissistic reaction

item.text: A chemical reaction that can be described as the conversion of a reactant into its mirror image, without rotation or translation of the product, so that the product enantiomer actually coincides with the mirror image of the reactant molecule. Examples of such reactions are cited under the entries fluxional and degenerate rearrangement.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 1077. 'Glossary of terms used in physical organic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 1144 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466051077)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
